abstracts.cdata!:
This project paper on the Emergency 2007
            Flood Restoration and Recovery Assistance Program (FRRAP) of
            Bangladesh seeks the restructuring of seven projects to
            three of the projects [Social Investment Social Investment
            Program Project (Cr. 3740), Municipal  Services Project (Cr.
            3177) and Rural Transport Improvement Project (Cr. 3791)].
            The additional financing will be used to support the
            Emergency 2007 Flood Restoration and Recovery Assistance
            Program (2007 FRRAP) in Bangladesh. The restructuring of
            above-referenced projects, including the additional
            financing, will form part of the larger IDA support package
            for 2007 FRRAP, which also includes funding embedded in the
            ongoing projects mentioned above and two other credits
            (Health, Nutrition and Population Sector Program, Cr.4052,
            and Primary Education Program 11, Cr 3857. The credit
            closing dates of three Credits (Cr. 3177, Cr. 3791 and Cr.
            3740) will be extended to June 30, 2011. The Emergency 2007
            FRRAP consists of two components: (A) infrastructure
            rehabilitation covering (i) rehabilitation of secondary,
            regional, and rural roads, (ii) reconstruction of bridges
            and culverts (iii) rehabilitation of urban roads, bridges
            and culverts, and drainage facilities in municipalities,
            (iv) rehabilitation of health facilities, (v) rehabilitation
            of flood embankments, flood control and drainage, and
            irrigation schemes, (vi) rehabilitation of water supply and
            sanitation facilities, and (B) livelihood restoration
            through low interest loans and community projects. The flood
            restoration works will support sectors where the Bank is
            currently financing regular investments. Concerned
            Government of Bangladesh (GOB) line ministries and
            departments will be accountable for their respective
            infrastructure rehabilitation within the framework of
            ongoing projects. This ensures overall rapid and effective
            implementation without major amendments to each project design.
